title: The Delineator

renewed-contributions.title: Huckleberry Finn
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record gives title as 'Huckelberry Finn'. We have not examined the issue ourselves, but other sources show the article title as 'Huckleberry Finn', the usual spelling of the title of Mark Twain's book.

The Pattern of a Woman's Life

renewed-contributions.title: A Sonnet
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record gives title as 'Since of No Creature Living', the first five words of the sonnet.

renewed-contributions.title: With Love From Anne
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record gives title as 'Practically Sober', a phrase used at the end of the story.

renewed-contributions.title: Widow's Evening
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record gives title as 'Widows Evening'.

author.authorized: Wylie, I. A. R. (Ida Alexa Ross), 1885-1959

renewed-contributions.title: From the Horn of the Moon
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record gives title as 'Willie the Wagger', the name of a character in the story.

author.authorized: Wylie, I. A. R. (Ida Alexa Ross), 1885-1959

renewed-contributions.title: Mr. Penny and the Rhine Maiden
Mrs. Joshua Butter
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record gives date of this story as July 1933. See note on a similar title in September 1933.  We have not examined this issue to verify its contents.

author.authorized: Wylie, I. A. R. (Ida Alexa Ross), 1885-1959

renewed-contributions.title: Mr. Fortune is On the Case! The Mystery of Mrs. Joshua Butter
renewed-contributions.note: Title given as it appears in the issue.  The renewal record for Bailey associated with this month gives a title of 'The Love Bird', but we do not find a story with that title in this issue. The renewal record for 'Mrs. Joshua Butter' gives a date of July 1933, as noted above; we do not know if there is a story with that title in that issue.

renewed-contributions.title: I Too Beneath Your Moon, Almighty Sex: Sonnet

additional-notes: We have not yet surveyed contribution renewals in the CCE volumes for 1951, 1952, or January-June 1953, so some renewed copyrights for 1923-1926 contributions might not be represented above. The list above, however, includes mentions of the Delineator in all other volumes covering active renewals prior to the merger with Pictorial Review.

Except where noted, titles and issue dates are as given in the renewal records.  In Delineator volumes we have examined, we have found some discrepancies between what appears in the issues and what appears in the renewal records; in those cases, we first note what appears in the issues.  Some sources also suggest discrepancies in other volumes we have not had the chance to examine.
